results.title: Back room of the sky
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Life”.
A survey of work carried out at the Ministry of Aviation Research Centre at Boscombe Down. Aiming always for increased safety and efficiency, all sections of a new aircraft must be rigorously tested and teams of pilots, scientists and engineers seek out any flaws which must be corrected before a machine becomes operational. The men who will fly the aircraft are also seen undergoing tests at Boscombe Down. Narrated by Raymond Baxter.

group_siblings.title: Look at life: Bronze silver and gold

results.title: Back in circulation
results.brief_description: This film looks at a group of amputee soldiers, shortly after the Second World War. It looks at their rehabilitation, beginning with a visit to the “Limbless Soldiers Association, N.S.W.Aquatic Club” where soldiers come together for a water carnival. The film goes on to the Lady Gowrie Hospital and the Rehabilitation Artificial Limb Factory where the workers are amputees. No other credits available.

results.title: Baby crazy
results.brief_description: Being a parent is one of humanity’s most demanding and rewarding experiences - a mixture of infatuation, mad passion, fear, fun, guilt and enduring love. This amusing documentary looks at four young couples who share their intimate experiences of parenting by providing privileged access to rare moments on home video recordings and interviews. It’s a fascinating story of how a family grows and changes. “Baby Crazy” is narrated by well known actress Noni Hazelhurst, and is almost required viewing for soon to be parents, baby watchers, and baby lovers. It shows all the sensual, tender, crazy and fun-filled aspects of babyhood along with the pain and not so fun-filled aspects of having a child. Inspired by the book “Baby Crazy” by Helen Townsend.

results.title: Baboon development: the older infant, four months to one year (Nairobi Park)
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Educational Services, Ford Foundation and National Science Foundation
results.brief_description: Part of a series of films on the baboons of Kenya. Shows without commentary or narration, the growth and development of a baby baboon over one year of its life.

results.title: Babies need books
results.creator_credit: New Zealand Trade & Enterprise and New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A mother, grandmother, teacher and children’s bookseller, Dorothy Butler believes that books should play a crucial role in children’s lives right from the first months. The film is an informative and entertaining introduction to 58 favourite children’s books.

results.title: Babe [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Bill Miller, Doug Mitchell, George Miller, Kennedy-Miller and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: This is the story of an unprejudiced heart and how it changed our valley forever. So begins “Babe”, the critically acclaimed, oscar-nominated film where the animals are the true stars. It is the tale of Hoggett’s farm where every creature has a purpose until the orphaned piglet Babe arrives and turns everything upside down. Cared for by Fly the sheepdog, he soon comes to think of himself as a dog. Farmer Hoggett senses something special in Babe and though everyone thinks he is crazy, enters him in the National Sheepdog Championships. This is a truly heartwarming tale about having faith in your abilities and being true to your heart.

results.title: B.W.D.
results.brief_description: Bacillary White Diarrhoea causes an annual loss to the British poultry industry of millions of pounds. The disease can be controlled by careful precautions, including blood-testing of stock and scrupulous attention to hygiene at all stages. This film explains the precautions necessary and gives details of the United Kingdom Ministry of Agriculture’s scheme to combat the disease.

results.title: Avoiding danger
results.creator_credit: Paul White and National Association of Citizens Advice Bureau
results.brief_description: In July 1986 Estate Agent, Suzy Lamplugh, disappeared while on a client appointment. The Suzy Lamplugh Trust was set up to encourage increased awareness among employers and staff of the potential danger from attack in the workplace. The Trust is engaged in comprehensive research in the field of personal vulnerability, and is developing courses to promote greater understanding of the ways to minimise risk. There are practical steps that everyone can take. First, AVOID potential risk by following cautionary procedures. TALK in ways that will placate rather than provoke customers or clients who are aggressive. WALK away from danger. DEFEND yourself if all other methods fail.
